Roman cities were also defined by the pomerium. Caesar's legislation concerning Rome also indicated that the laws were operative within one mile of continuous habitation of the city; see Tabula Heracleensis

The duties of the magisterial board in charge of the city's streets was limited to one mile outside the city. A board of two magistrates was responsible for the roads in the countryside, see Abbott and Johnson

The tombs of rich citizens were often impressive public monuments in their own right. At Termessos, tombs are located on the heights overlooking the city but within the city walls; and at Ariassos an impressive series of tombs was immediately adjacent to the main civic centre.
title: The question of intramural burial is complicated. According to Cicero, Ad Familiares iv 12. 3, it was not permitted in Athens on the grounds of religion, although infant burial was apparently exempted
The burial and cremation of dead bodies in Rome was forbidden by the law of the Twelve Tables
